get.summary: Get custom fields configured in a project.
get.description:
## Usage
List all the custom fields configured in a specified project.
Custom fields may be filtered by archived status. By default returns not archived fields.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

parameters.name: archive
parameters.description: Filter by archive status. Valid values are `all`, `archived` and `not-archived`.

Custom field can not be deleted, only archived. Archived custom field may be restored.

- `CDE:NameShouldBeUnique` - when creating or changing enumeration item code.
- `CDE:CustomFieldTypeMismatch` - when trying to change enumeration items for custom field of type other than `enumeration`.

get.summary: Get list of model revisions with specified filter.
get.description:
## Usage
Get list of model revisions with specified filter.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies filter by text that should be contained in revision comment.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/projects/3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6/models/3a17dd6a-bc6a-9590-1c4a-9629c2930519/?$orderBy=version&$search=something&$skip=10&$top=10

```
            
### Authorization
User should be authenticated.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have a permission to read models.

post.description:
## Usage
Uploads new model file creating a new model revision of next version.
File should be in `.ifc` or `.ifczip` format and has a size limit of 1 Gb.
            
## Authorization
User should be authenticated.

403.description: User does not have a permission to upload models.

get.description:
## Usage
Returns model revision by model id and version number.
            
## Authorization
User should be authenticated.

403.description: User does not have a permission to read models.

put.description:
## Usage
Allows to change model revision comment.
            
## Authorization
User should be authenticated.

403.description: User does not have a permission to update model revision.

get.description:
## Usage
Allows to download model revision file in specified format.
File format is defined by `Accept` header.
Allowed formats are:
- `application/ifc` - download original IFC model file
- `application/gltf-binary` - download 3D geometry model generated by BimScanner IFC converter
- `bimscanner/ifc-xml` - download model metadata file generated by BimScanner IFC converter
- `application/xkt` - download model in Xeokit .xkt v11 format
            
## Authorization
User should be authenticated.

403.description: User does not have access to specified file.

get.summary: Get status of model conversion job.
get.description:
## Usage
Returns status of specified model conversion job.
            
## Authorization
User should be authenticated.

403.description: User does not have a permission to read models.

get.summary: Get list of models with specified filter.
get.description:
## Usage
Get list of models with specified filter.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in model name.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/projects/3fa85f64-5717-4562-b3fc-2c963f66afa6/models?$orderBy=name&$search=something&$skip=10&$top=10

```
            
### Authorization
User should be authenticated.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have a permission to read models.

get.summary: Get latest notifications for current user.
get.description:
## Usage
Returns latest notifications for current user in order from newest to oldest.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

## Usage
Gets notification by its ID.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

## Usage
Endpoint returns an array of permission groups and permissions with their statuses.
Every permission has a unique `name` that is used for its identification.
Permission may be granted to a user by following means:
- User may be in a role that has been granted the permission;
- The permission has been granted to the specific user manually.

The endpoint allows to get permissions defined with both methods.

To get permissions defined by a role use:
- `providerName` = `R`
- `providerKey` = role `name` (e.g. `default_user`)

To get permissions defined by specific user use:
- `providerName` = `U`
- `providerKey` = user `id` (e.g. `3a178060-6ee4-8d90-cf59-d502a1a4228f`)

### Authorization
User should be authenticated.

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description:
Permissions provider type.
Supported provider types:
- `U` - get permissions granted by user
- `R` - get permissions granted by role

parameters.name: providerKey
parameters.description:
Entity key specific to permissions provider type:
- For user provider (`providerName` = `U`) - key is `id` of the user.
- For role provider (`providerName` = `R`) - key is `name` of the role.

put.description:
## Usage
Set permission value for specific user or role.

Every permission has a unique `name` that is used for its identification.
Permission may be granted to a user by following means:
- User may be in a role that has been granted the permission;
- The permission has been granted to the specific user manually.

The endpoint allows to set specific permission defined with both methods.

To set permissions for a role use:
- `providerName` = `R`
- `providerKey` = role `name` (e.g. `default_user`)

To set permission for specific user use:
- `providerName` = `U`
- `providerKey` = user `id` (e.g. `3a178060-6ee4-8d90-cf59-d502a1a4228f`)

### Authorization
User should have following permissions:
- To set permissions for user: `AbpIdentity.Users.ManagePermissions`
- To set permissions for role: `AbpIdentity.Roles.ManagePermissions`

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description:
Permissions provider type.
Supported provider types:
- `U` - set permission value for specific user
- `R` - set permission value for role

parameters.name: providerKey
parameters.description:
Entity key specific to permissions provider type:
- For user provider (`providerName` = `U`) - key is `id` of the user.
- For role provider (`providerName` = `R`) - key is `name` of the role.

get.description:
## Usage
Get users that are members of specified project.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in user name or email.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
### Authorization
User should have permission to read project members.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
### Authorization

parameters.name: $filter

parameters.name: $orderBy

### Error codes

get.summary: Search in all projects, regardless of membership status.
get.description:
## Usage
Search in all projects, regardless of user project membership status.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in project name.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/projects/all?$orderBy=creationTime&$filter=contains(description,'something')&$search=proj&$skip=10&$top=10

```
            
### Authorization
Requires system permission `CDEProjects.ReadAll`.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have necessary permissions.

## Usage

- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in project name.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/projects?$orderBy=creationTime&$filter=contains(description,'something')&$search=proj&$skip=10&$top=10

```
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip

get.summary: Get flat list of project topic boards and parent groups.
get.description:
## Usage
Returns collection of topic boards which names match the search string.
For each matching board all parent groups are also loaded.
            
If query parameter `searchGroups` is set, matching groups are loaded.
For every matching group all parent groups and direct children are loaded.
            
### Authorization

parameters.description: If true, search also in board groups names.

parameters.name: includeChildren

put.description:
## Usage
Updates topic boards group.
Allows to move group in hierarchy by changing `parentGroupId` when keeping following restrictions:
- The group can not be moved into itself of any of its children
- Maximum hierarchy depth is 5 groups deep.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.
            
### Error codes
- `CDE:TopicBoardsGroupNestingTooDeep`
- `CDE:CanNotMoveTopicBoardsGroupIntoItself`
- `CDE:CanNotMoveTopicBoardsGroupIntoChild`

Any contained in group topic boards are moved into hierarchy root.

patch.summary: Edit custom fields of a topic board.
patch.description:
## Usage
Makes changes to the topic board custom fields configuration.
            
When adding or modifying custom fields default value format depends on custom field type:
- for date fields value should contain a date in RFC3339 format
- for bool fields value should be either `true` or `false`
- for enumeration fields default value should contain one of enumeration items id.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.
            
### Error codes:
- `CDE:CustomFieldAlreadyExists` - when trying to add custom field that was already added to a topic board.
- `CDE:CustomFieldInvalidValueFormat` - when custom field default value can not be parsed according to custom field type.
- `CDE:CustomFieldValueIsRequired` - when trying to set empty default value to a field marked as required.

requestBody.description: Data defining changes to topic board custom fields.

delete.description:
## Usage
Removes the topic board.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

get.summary: Get comment change events in a topic board.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of events describing comment changes grouped by date.
            
Note: Whenever a comment has been created, the server also generates "update" events.
            
Comment event types:
| type | value |
| --- | --- |
| comment_created 	| null |
| comment_text_updated | The comment text(limit: 1024 characters) |
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order. Events can be sorted only by `creationTime`,
  e.g. `$orderBy=creationTime` (this is the default order) or `$orderBy=creationTime desc`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Supported parameters for filtering are:
- `topicId` - id of the parent topic
- `commentId` - id of the comment
- `author` - object representing the modification author
- `type` - string type of the event
- `creationTime` - date-time when the event took place
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET api/issues/boards/{topicBoardId}/topics/comments/events?$orderBy=creationTime desc&$filter=author/name eq 'admin' and type eq 'comment_created'&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have necessary permissions.

404.description: Entity does not exist or has been deleted.

get.summary: Get change events for a topic comment.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of events describing comment changes grouped by date.
            
Note: Whenever a comment has been created, the server also generates "update" events.
            
Topic event types:
| type | value |
| --- | --- |
| comment_created 	| null |
| comment_text_updated | The comment text(limit: 1024 characters) |
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order. Events can be sorted only by `creationTime`,
  e.g. `$orderBy=creationTime` (this is the default order) or `$orderBy=creationTime desc`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Supported parameters for filtering are:
- `topicId` - id of the parent topic
- `commentId` - id of the comment
- `author` - object representing the modification author
- `type` - string type of the event
- `creationTime` - date-time when the event took place
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET api/issues/boards/{topicBoardId}/topics/{topicId}/comments/{commentId}/events?$orderBy=creationTime desc&$filter=author/name eq 'admin' and type eq 'comment_text_updated'&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have necessary permissions.

404.description: Entity does not exist or has been deleted.

get.summary: Get all topic change events in a topic board.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of events describing topic changes grouped by date.
            
Note: Whenever a topic has been created, the server also generates "update" and "add" events for all fields
that are initially set. Example: If a topic contains a description, the `description_updated` event is generated.
            
Topic event types:
| type | value |
| --- | --- |
| topic_created 	| null |
| title_updated | The title(limit: 128 characters) |
| description_updated | The description(limit: 1024 characters) |
| description_removed 	| null |
| status_updated | The status name |
| type_updated | The type name |
| priority_updated | The priority name |
| priority_removed 	| null |
| due_date_updated | The due date |
| due_date_removed 	| null |
| assigned_to_updated | The assigned user display name |
| assigned_to_removed 	| null |
| label_added | The added label name |
| label_removed | The removed label name |
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order. Events can be sorted only by `creationTime`,
  e.g. `$orderBy=creationTime` (this is the default order) or `$orderBy=creationTime desc`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Supported parameters for filtering are:
- `topicId` - uuid identifying the related topic.
- `author` - object representing the modification author
- `type` - string type of the event
- `creationTime` - date-time when the event took place
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/issues/boards/{topicBoardId}/topics/events?$orderBy=creationTime desc&$filter=author/name eq 'user1' and type eq 'topic_created'&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have necessary permissions.

404.description: Entity does not exist or has been deleted.

get.summary: Get topic change events for a specified topic.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of events describing topic changes grouped by date.
            
Note: Whenever a topic has been created, the server also generates "update" and "add" events for all fields
that are initially set. Example: If a topic contains a description, the `description_updated` event is generated.
            
Topic event types:
| type | value |
| --- | --- |
| topic_created 	| null |
| title_updated | The title(limit: 128 characters) |
| description_updated | The description(limit: 1024 characters) |
| description_removed 	| null |
| status_updated | The status name |
| type_updated | The type name |
| priority_updated | The priority name |
| priority_removed 	| null |
| due_date_updated | The due date |
| due_date_removed 	| null |
| assigned_to_updated | The assigned user display name |
| assigned_to_removed 	| null |
| label_added | The added label name |
| label_removed | The removed label name |
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order. Events can be sorted only by `creationTime`,
  e.g. `$orderBy=creationTime` (this is the default order) or `$orderBy=creationTime desc`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Supported parameters for filtering are:
- `author` - object representing the modification author

- `creationTime` - date-time when the event took place
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/issues/boards/{topicBoardId}/topics/{topicId}/events?$orderBy=creationTime desc&$filter=author/name eq 'user1' and type eq 'topic_created'&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Authorization

get.summary: Retrieves a list of topics for a specific topic board.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of topics associated with a specific topic board.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in project name.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/issues/boards/{topicBoardId}/topics?$orderBy=creationTime&$search=example&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Response
The endpoint returns the total number of topics in the `X-Total-Count` response header along with the paginated collection of topics in the body.
            
### Authorization
Users must have permission to access the topics associated with the specified topic board.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Ids of the labels that should be attached to topic. All specified labels should be present.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

403.description: User does not have necessary permissions.

post.description:
## Usage
Creates a new topic on specified topic board.
            
### Authorization
Requires authenticated user.

requestBody.description: The BimScanner.CDE.Topics.CreateTopicDto containing details of the topic to create.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of topics for a specific project.
get.description:
## Usage
Retrieves a list of topics associated with a specific project.
            
Endpoint supports a following subset of OData query options:
- `$filter` - specify items filter using [OData query operators](https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#sec_SystemQueryOptions)
- `$search` - applies case-insensitive filter by text that should be contained in project name.
- `$orderBy` - defines items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc,creationDate`.
- `$top` - requests the number of items in the queried collection to be included in the result.
- `$skip` - requests the number of items in the queried collection that are to be skipped and not included in the result.
            
Example query may look like this:
```

GET /api/projects/{projectId}/topics?$orderBy=creationTime&$search=example&$skip=10&$top=5

```
            
### Response
The endpoint returns the total number of topics in the `X-Total-Count` response header along with the paginated collection of topics in the body.
            
### Authorization
Users must have permission to access the topics associated with the specified project.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Ids of the labels that should be attached to topic. All specified labels should be present.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify items filter using OData query operators

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Define items sorting order in format e.g. `$orderBy=name desc, creationTime`

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of items to skip from the beginning of requested collection. Used for pagination.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of items to take from requested collection. Used for pagination.

Default value format depends on custom field type:
- for date fields value should contain a date in RFC3339 format
- for bool fields value should be either `true` or `false`
- for enumeration fields default value should contain one of enumeration items id.
